synthesis_conditions.additional_procedure: A solution of Co(NO3)2·6H2O and pyridine in MeOH was layered onto a solution of 4,4‘-bipyridine in benzene.
The reaction vessel was placed in an ice bath to induce crystallization.

materials.yield: two types of crystals, colored violet and peach, respectively

crystal_data.stability: stable for approximately 1 h in the absence of mother liquor
crystal_data.refinement: Non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically. Benzene guest molecules were refined as rigid hexagons with a C−C distance of 1.39 Å, and thermal parameters were allowed to refine anisotropically. Hydrogen atoms were fixed at calculated positions and refined using a riding model.

materials.notes: The structure was also refined in centrosymmetric space groups C2/c and I2/a, but disordered guest molecules and relatively high R-factors were obtained.
